revised_title: Muscular Fibre Structure in Animal and Organic Life
tldr: The author examines the structure of muscular fibers in both animal and organic life using a microscope. They discovered that the fibers have a fine reticulated cellular structure and are connected by delicate forceps. The fibers have a natural straight direction and contain transverse striations, which are more visible in certain animals. The striations are formed by the elevation of the fibers and create a regular pattern. The author also discusses the differences in the appearance of striations in various examples of muscular fibers.
